question: Which 90s sitcom featured a group of friends living in New York City?
funFact: Friends premiered in 1994 and ran for 10 seasons, becoming one of the most popular sitcoms of all time.

question: What was the name of the coffee shop in Friends?
funFact: Central Perk was the fictional coffee shop where the Friends characters often gathered.

question: Which 90s sitcom starred Will Smith as a teenager from Philadelphia?
funFact: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air ran from 1990 to 1996 and launched Will Smith's acting career.

question: What was the catchphrase of Steve Urkel in Family Matters?
funFact: Steve Urkel's 'Did I do that?' became one of the most famous catchphrases of the 1990s.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured the Tanner family in San Francisco?
funFact: Full House aired from 1987 to 1995 and was one of the most popular family sitcoms of the era.

question: What was the name of the high school in Saved by the Bell?
funFact: Bayside High was the fictional school where Zack, Kelly, Slater, and Screech attended.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a talking baby named Stewie?
funFact: Family Guy premiered in 1999, though it became more popular in the 2000s.

question: What was the name of the bar in Cheers?
funFact: Cheers ran from 1982 to 1993, with most of its run in the 1990s.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured the Winslow family and their nerdy neighbor?
funFact: Family Matters introduced Steve Urkel in season 1, and he became the show's breakout character.

question: What was the name of the diner in Seinfeld?
funFact: Monk's Cafe was the fictional diner where the Seinfeld characters often met.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with three daughters and their father Danny?
funFact: Full House featured Danny Tanner raising his three daughters with help from his brother-in-law and best friend.

question: What was the name of the apartment building in Friends?
funFact: Monica's apartment was a central location in Friends, though the building's actual name was rarely mentioned.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with stepchildren from previous marriages?
funFact: Step by Step featured Frank and Carol, who each had three children from previous marriages.

question: What was the name of the coffee shop owner in Friends?
funFact: Gunther was played by James Michael Tyler and was the manager of Central Perk.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family living in the suburbs with a talking baby?
funFact: Family Guy's Stewie Griffin is known for his sophisticated vocabulary and evil plans.

question: What was the name of the high school in Boy Meets World?
funFact: Boy Meets World followed Cory Matthews from middle school through college.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a talking dog?
funFact: Family Guy's Brian Griffin is the family's talking dog who is more intelligent than most humans.

question: What was the name of the bar where the gang hung out in How I Met Your Mother?
funFact: How I Met Your Mother premiered in 2005, but it was inspired by 90s sitcoms like Friends.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a robot maid?
funFact: The Jetsons originally aired in the 1960s but had a revival in the 1980s and 1990s.

question: What was the name of the apartment building in Seinfeld?
funFact: Jerry's apartment was a central location in Seinfeld, located at 129 West 81st Street.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a talking baby and a dog?
funFact: Family Guy features both Stewie (the talking baby) and Brian (the talking dog).

question: What was the name of the coffee shop in Frasier?
funFact: Cafe Nervosa was the coffee shop where Frasier and Niles often met in the spin-off series.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a talking baby who wanted to take over the world?
funFact: Stewie Griffin's original character arc involved him trying to kill his mother and take over the world.

question: What was the name of the high school in Saved by the Bell: The New Class?
funFact: Saved by the Bell: The New Class continued at Bayside High with a new group of students.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a talking baby and a talking dog?
funFact: Family Guy is unique for having both a talking baby (Stewie) and a talking dog (Brian) as main characters.

question: What was the name of the apartment building in Friends?
funFact: Monica and Rachel's apartment was located at 90 Bedford Street in Greenwich Village.

question: Which 90s sitcom featured a family with a talking baby who was a genius?
funFact: Stewie Griffin is portrayed as a genius baby with advanced vocabulary and knowledge.
